Dear Ms. Zalewski
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
9/13/2022. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
This is a non-contracted agency and therefore not required to follow MISEP
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1.
This is a non-contracted agency and therefore not required to follow MDHHS
policy/contract.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The CAP, approved 9/15/2021, was the result of the 8/26/2021 renewal evaluation.
The agency was cited for outdated youth photos in two case files. During this review,
the agency demonstrated full compliance in this area. There were no repeat
violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment was reviewed and discussed on-site. During the
past year, the agency successfully implemented CAP steps from the prior review.
The agency had a time period of being short staffed. However, they are now fully
staffed and caseloads are within the required range. Overall, the Chief Administrator
reported growth and improvement over the past year, despite challenges of
undergoing an office remodel and being displaced over the past several months.
Interviews
Two staff were interviewed: one foster care and one licensing. Both staff reported
being satisfied with their work in the refugee program. Both staff indicated they have
supportive and knowledgeable supervisors, that make their job enjoyable. Neither
4

staff had any suggestions for improvement at the agency.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
A field analyst review was not completed as this is a non-contracted agency.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
_ _____________September 16, 2022__________________
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
